fields.name: workflow
fields.description:
Returns the specified Workflow object.

Access is permitted when any of the following condition(s) are met:
    1. The signed-in User has any of the following permissions for the associated Organization: [org_admin_integration_permissions, org_manage_integrations, org_view_integrations].
    2. The signed-in User has any of the following permissions for any version of the object: [integration_admin_permissions, integration_view, integration_edit, integration_remove].
    3. The signed-in User has any of the following permissions for the associated Customer of Integrations available in the Marketplace: [customer_admin_instance_deploy, customer_manage_marketplace_integrations].
    4. The signed-in User has any of the following permissions for the associated Customer of Integrations available in the Marketplace: [customer_access_marketplace_integrations].
    5. The signed-in User has any of the following permissions for the object's 'customer' attribute: [customer_admin_integration_permissions, customer_manage_integrations, customer_view_integrations].
    6. The Customer User has any of the following permissions for the Customer and the Objects Attribute template_configuration is AVAILABLE: [customer_admin_integration_permissions, customer_manage_integrations, customer_view_integrations].

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the Workflow object.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: DateTime
types.description:
The `DateTime` scalar type represents a DateTime
value as specified by
[iso8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Workflow
types.description:
Represents the collection of information that defines a Workflow, to
include the sequence of Component Actions, or steps, inputs,
the trigger, and other associated data.

belong to a Customer, which itself belongs to an Organization.

specify a complete set of data necessary for interaction with an external
resource by a Component Action as part of an Integration.

fields.name: org
fields.description: The Organization the Credential belongs to, if any. If NULL then Customer will be specified.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The Customer the Credential belongs to, if any. If NULL then Organization will be specified.

fields.name: label
fields.description: The name of the Credential.

fields.name: authorizationMethod
fields.description: The specific AuthorizationMethod used by the Credential.

fields.name: readyForUse
fields.description: Specifies whether the Credential is ready for use by an Instance.

fields.name: refreshAt
fields.description: The timestamp at which the OAuth2 token will automatically be refreshed, if necessary. Only applies to OAuth2 methods where refresh is necessary.

fields.name: authorizationError
fields.description: Contains any error message generated by the external authorizing system that occurred during authorization.

fields.name: token
fields.description: Contains OAuth2 token data if applicable.

fields.name: context
fields.description: Contains OAuth2 context data if applicable.

fields.name: values
fields.description: A list of CredentialFieldValues that contain the values for the CredentialFields.

fields.name: redirectUri
fields.description: Contains the OAuth2 Redirect URI if applicable.

fields.name: allowUpdate
fields.description: Specifies whether the signed-in User can update the Credential.

fields.name: allowRemove
fields.description: Specifies whether the signed-in User can remove the Credential.

types.name: Customer

Represents a customer, which is an object that allows for logical
separation of Users, Instances, and other data that are specific to a
particular deployment of the Organization's product(s).

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the object

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The timestamp at which the object was created.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description: The timestamp at which the object was most recently updated.

fields.name: labels
fields.description: The labels that are associated with the object.

fields.name: avatarUrl
fields.description: The URL for the avatar image.

fields.name: externalId
fields.description: Allows for mapping an external entity to a Prismatic record.

fields.description: The name of the Customer, which must be unique within the scope of its Organization.

fields.name: org
fields.description: The Organization to which the Customer belongs.

fields.description: Specifies whether this Customer can use the Embedded Designer.

fields.description: The maximum number of concurrent executions allowed for this Customer. If null, no Customer-specific limit is enforced.

fields.name: users
fields.description: The Customer the user belongs to, if any. If this is NULL then Organization will be specified.

types.name: Instance

context of a Customer, to include Config Variable values, Credentials, and
a specific version of an Integration.

types.name: IntegrationFlow
types.description:
Relates an Integration to a hierarchical structure of Component Actions
that define the behavior of one of potentially several workflows that
comprise the Integration.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the object

fields.name: stableId
fields.description: Represents identity across different integration versions. Not intended to be used directly by end users, as the implementation may change at any time.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The displayed name of the IntegrationFlow.

fields.name: stableKey
fields.description: A user-provided value that represents identity across multiple integration versions and across flow renames.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Additional notes about the IntegrationFlow.

fields.name: sortOrder
fields.description: The order in which the IntegrationFlow will appear in the UI.

fields.name: isSynchronous
fields.description: Specifies whether responses to Executions of this IntegrationFlow are synchronous. Responses are asynchronous by default.

fields.name: retryMaxAttempts
fields.description: Specifies the maximum number of retry attempts that will be performed for Executions of this IntegrationFlow.

fields.name: retryDelayMinutes
fields.description: Specifies the delay in minutes between retry attempts of Executions of this IntegrationFlow.

fields.name: retryUsesExponentialBackoff
fields.description: Specifies whether to use exponential backoff in scheduling retries of Executions of this IntegrationFlow.

fields.name: usesFifoQueue
fields.description: Specifies whether FIFO queue processing is enabled for this IntegrationFlow.

fields.name: singletonExecutions
fields.description: Specifies whether only a single execution of this flow can run at a time.

fields.name: lastExecutedAt
fields.description: The timestamp at which this IntegrationFlow was most recently executed as part of an Instance.

fields.name: endpointSecurityType
fields.description: Specifies the security configuration to use for the endpoint of this IntegrationFlow.

fields.name: schemas
fields.description: Defines schemas to apply to executions of this flow

fields.name: isAgentFlow
fields.description: Specifies whether this flow is designated as an agent flow for the MCP Server.

fields.name: trigger
fields.description: The IntegrationAction that is the trigger for the Integration Flow.

fields.name: testUrl
fields.description: The URL of the endpoint that triggers execution of the Integration Flow in the Test Runner.

fields.name: testPayload
fields.description: Data payload for testing this Integration Flow.

fields.name: testExecutionResults
fields.description: The Execution Results that were generated during testing.

fields.name: id

fields.description: The Instance which created the Log entry.

fields.description: The InstanceConfigVariable which relates to the Log entry.

fields.name: userLevelConfigVariable
fields.description: The UserLevelConfigVariable which relates to the Log entry.

fields.name: requiredConfigVariableKey
fields.description: The key of the Required Config Variable which relates to the Log entry.

fields.name: executionResult
fields.description: The specific InstanceExecutionResult that is associated with the Log entry.

fields.name: isTestExecution
fields.description: Specifies whether the associated Execution was created as part of testing.

fields.name: fromPreprocessFlow
fields.description: Specifies whether the Log was generated as part of the associated Integration's Preprocess Flow.

fields.name: integration
fields.description: The specific Integration that is associated with the Log entry.

fields.name: integrationName
fields.description: The name of the Integration that is associated with the Log entry.

fields.name: integrationVersionSequenceId
fields.description: The identifier for the version sequence of the Integration that is associated with the Log entry.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: The specific Customer that is associated with the Log entry.

fields.name: customerName
fields.description: The name of the Customer that is associated with the Log entry.

fields.name: flow
fields.description: The specific IntegrationFlow that is associated with the Log entry.

fields.name: flowName
fields.description: The name of the IntegrationFlow that is associated with the Log entry.

fields.name: stepName
fields.description: The name of the IntegrationAction that generated this Log entry.

fields.name: loopStepName
fields.description: The name of the IntegrationAction that is the Loop containing the IntegrationAction that generated this Log entry, if any.

fields.name: loopStepIndex
fields.description: The iteration index of the containing Loop IntegrationAction at the time this Log entry was generated, if any.

fields.name: loopPath
fields.description: A string containing a sequence of space-separated 'loopStepName:iterationNumber' tokens that allow this Log to be requested based solely on loop positions and iteration numbers

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: The timestamp at which the Log was created.

fields.name: severity
fields.description: The severity level of the Log entry.

fields.name: message
fields.description: The message body of the Log entry.

fields.name: scopedConfigVariable
fields.description: The ScopedConfigVariable which relates to the Log entry.

fields.name: customerConfigVariable

types.name: InstanceStepResult
types.description:
Represents the result of executing a specific step of an Integration as
part of an Instance execution.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the object

fields.name: executionResult
fields.description: The InstanceExecutionResult to which the InstanceStepResult is associated.

fields.name: instance
fields.description: The Instance to which the InstanceStepResult is associated.

fields.name: startedAt
fields.description: The timestamp at which execution of the step started.

fields.name: endedAt
fields.description: The timestamp at which execution of the step ended.

fields.name: stepName
fields.description: The name of the IntegrationAction that generated this result.

fields.name: stepStableKey
fields.description: The stable key of the IntegrationAction that generated this result.

fields.name: displayStepName
fields.description: The display name of the IntegrationAction that generated this result.

fields.name: loopStepName
fields.description: The name of the IntegrationAction that is the Loop containing the IntegrationAction that generated this result, if any.

fields.name: loopStepIndex
fields.description: The iteration index of the containing Loop IntegrationAction at the time this result was generated, if any.

fields.name: isLoopStep
fields.description: Specifies whether the result was generated by a Loop IntegrationAction.

fields.name: loopPath
fields.description: A string containing a sequence of space-separated 'loopStepName:iterationNumber' tokens that allow this result to be requested based solely on loop positions and iteration numbers

fields.name: isRootResult
fields.description: Identifies whether this is a 'root level' result or whether this is contained in a loop.

fields.name: branchName
fields.description: The name of the branch containing the IntegrationAction that generated this result, if any.

fields.name: hasError
fields.description: Specifies whether this step result had an error during execution.

fields.name: fromPreprocessFlow
fields.description: Specifies whether the result was generated as part of the associated Integration's Preprocess Flow.

fields.name: componentActionKey
fields.description: A JSON value that contains attributes which uniquely identify the Component Action which generated this result.

fields.name: resultsUrl
fields.description: The presigned URL to download the result of this specific step of the Instance execution.

fields.name: resultsMetadataUrl
fields.description: The presigned URL to fetch metadata of the result of this specific step of the Instance execution.

fields.name: loopInputsUrl
fields.description: The presigned URL to download the inputs for this specific step if it is a Loop step.

fields.name: loopInputsMetadataUrl
fields.description: The presigned URL to fetch metadata of the inputs for this specific step if it is a Loop step.

fields.name: allowUpdate
fields.description: Specifies whether the signed-in User can update the InstanceStepResult.

fields.name: allowRemove
fields.description: Specifies whether the signed-in User can remove the InstanceStepResult.

fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

inputFields.name: direction

inputFields.name: field

types.name: InstanceStepResultOrderField
types.description: Represents the fields by which collections of the related type may be ordered.

fields.name: invokedBy
fields.description: Metadata referencing what invoked this execution and when.

fields.name: hasChildren
fields.description: Returns true if this execution invoked other executions.

fields.name: execution
fields.description: The execution that invoked this execution.

fields.name: customSource
fields.description: Represents a custom-defined origin for this execution.

fields.name: stepName
fields.description: The name of the step that invoked this execution.

fields.name: loopPath
fields.description: A string containing a sequence of space-separated 'loopStepName:iterationNumber' tokens that detail at what point in a loop this execution was invoked.

fields.name: componentActionKey
fields.description: A JSON value that contains attributes which uniquely identify the Component Action which invoked this execution.

args.name: before

types.name: ComponentDefinitionInput
types.description: Represents a collection of data that defines a Component.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: A string that uniquely identifies the Component.

inputFields.description: Specifies whether the Component is publicly available or whether it's private to the Organization.

inputFields.description: Specifies whether the Component is for a Code Native Integration.

inputFields.description: This field has been deprecated.

inputFields.description: Specifies how the Component is displayed.

inputFields.description: Specifies how the Component handles Authorization.

inputFields.name: documentationUrl
inputFields.description: The URL that specifies where the Component documentation exists.

types.description: Represents a collection of data that defines how a Component is displayed.

inputFields.name: label
inputFields.description: The name of the Component.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: Additional notes about the Component.

inputFields.name: category

inputFields.name: iconPath
inputFields.description: The URL that specifies where the Component icon exists.

types.description: Represents authorization details for a Component.

inputFields.name: required
inputFields.description: Specifies whether authorization is required for the Component.

inputFields.description: A string which uniquely identifies the Action in the context of the Component.

inputFields.name: display
inputFields.description: Specifies how the Component Action is displayed.

inputFields.description: The InputFields supported by the Component Action.

inputFields.description: Specifies how the Action handles Authorization.

inputFields.name: terminateExecution
inputFields.description: Specifies whether the Action will terminate Instance execution.

inputFields.name: breakLoop
inputFields.description: Specifies whether an Action will break out of a loop.

inputFields.name: allowsBranching
inputFields.description: Specifies whether the Action will allow Conditional Branching.

inputFields.name: staticBranchNames
inputFields.description: The static branch names associated with an Action.

inputFields.name: dynamicBranchInput
inputFields.description: The input associated with dynamic branching.

inputFields.name: examplePayload
inputFields.description: An example of the returned payload of an Action.

inputFields.name: canCallComponentFunctions
inputFields.description: Specifies whether the Action can call other Component Actions, Data Sources, or Triggers.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
